intro: Pimpinella leptoclada, commonly known as the slender cow-weed, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that resemble those of other members of its family. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often found in dry, rocky soils. Pimpinella leptoclada is typically grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ease of cultivation.
